mothball.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a small ball made of a strong-smelling chemical, used for keeping moths away from clothes
mothball.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to stop using a factory, equipment etc or to not continue with a plan, temporarily but possibly for a long time
mothball.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The hospital manager said the project would be mothballed until funding became available.
mothball.translation[2].definitions[0].d: if an organization mothballs a factory, building etc, it closes it or does not use it for a long time but may open it or use it again in the future
mothball.translation[2].definitions[0].e: The oil company plans to mothball one of its five refineries.
mothball.translation[2].definitions[1].d: if an organization mothballs plans, it decides not to use them for the moment but may possibly use them later
mothball.translation[2].definitions[1].e: No decisions have been made to mothball the project.
mothball.translation[3].definitions[0].d: if a building, factory etc or a plan is put in mothballs, it is no longer used but may be used later. If is taken out of mothballs, it is used again
mothball.translation[3].definitions[0].e: A number of its distillieries have been put in mothballs.
